simplified AMM (Automated Market Maker) implementation  Key Concepts: - Constant Product Formula: x * y = k - Liquidity Pools: Users can add/remove liquidity - Automated Pricing: No order books needed  Inspired by Uniswap V2 but simplified for learning","errors":{"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An params.amountA: Amount of Token A to add
params.amountB: Amount of Token B to add

returns.liquidityMinted: Amount of liquidity tokens minted  First liquidity provider sets the initial price ratio Subsequent providers must match the current ratio

constructor.details: Constructor - sets the two tokens that can be swapped

getAmountOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Calculate output amount using constant product formula

returns.amountOut: Amount of output token  Formula: amountOut = (amountIn * reserveOut) / (reserveIn + amountIn)  This is derived from: (reserveIn + amountIn) * (reserveOut - amountOut) = k where k = reserveIn * reserveOut  Note: In production, you'd apply a 0.3% fee here

getPrice().details: Get current price of Token A in terms of Token B

returns.price: How much Token B you get for 1 Token A (scaled by 1e18)

params.liquidityAmount: Amount of liquidity tokens to burn

swapAforB(uint256,uint256).details: Swap Token A for Token B

params.amountAIn: Amount of Token A to swap
params.minAmountBOut: Minimum amount of Token B expected (slippage protection)

returns.amountBOut: Actual amount of Token B received  Uses constant product formula: x * y = k

swapBforA(uint256,uint256).details: Swap Token B for Token A

params.amountBIn: Amount of Token B to swap
params.minAmountAOut: Minimum amount of Token A expected (slippage protection)

returns.amountAOut: Actual amount of Token A received
